Articles.Content:
I had the idea, specifically for Career mode, about having a pre-VAB construction phase where you would plan out the layout for your rocket, similar to how the VAB is now, except it would be in a little mock-up style design with Kerbal rocket scientists discussing it in the background. Or something like that.

I think that this "Pre-Construction" phase could add realism (in a sense), because you would actually have to wait a certain amount of time for a rocket to be constructed (but only for like 2 minutes or some such a thing), but in the mean time, you could fly pre-made Stock crafts to pass the time.

Discuss! I don't mean for this to be a solid idea.
why would you add wait time on rocket building?? How would we then do the boom town Mun bases that KSP is known for?

This has actually been discussed before. Not too long ago, now that I think about it. It's probably been brought up even before that.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/43440-Mission-Control-ChalkBoard?highlight=chalkboard

There it is. Some good thoughts and stuff came up in that thread, I'd say give it a read. Just a couple days before that thread was created, I remember seeing whiteboards talked about...though briefly, I think in another thread about the mission control building. Or something like that. I forget 'cause it was a while ago now >.>

My thought is that it's too easy to build a rocket already, and to muck it up with more stuff wont save you time.

HOWEVER:

My saved vehicle list is REALLY long, and it would be nice if I have a quick chalkboard mockup of the vehicles as I was scrolling through that menu. Some sort of wireframe the game could automatically generate. A thumbnail.
